channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024010593
item.description:
Report X-2024010593

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Concealed DG. The shipment was initially offered as UN3077 fully regulated without a Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods. It was returned to the shipper. The shipper reoffered it in a plain brown box. The box was suspected to contain undeclared dg. It was opened to reveal concealed DG. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024010118
item.description:
Report X-2024010118

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: All Packed In One. Multiple metal cans and glass bottles poorly wrapped in bubble wrap and poorly packed together in fibreboard outer packaging. multiple bottles broken. UN1268 UN1223 UN1593 UN1760. cleaned locally and secured in salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024010071
item.description:
Report X-2024010071

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 23rd a package was found during the sort that smelled like fuel and upon further investigation it appears to be some machinery that contains fuel. The closure for the fuel tank was loose and some fuel leaked inside the case. There are no markings, labels or documentation showing this as a regulated dangerous good. The package is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023121105
item.description:
Report X-2023121105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-26T15:11:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic jerrican was discovered leaking from a loose cap at the MEMH facility. The cap was tightened and the jerrycan was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for a amended shippers declaration for movement.
